sentence.Network_en: Diplomacy was in his blood: his ancestors had been feudal lords.

sentence.Network_en: His ancestors had come to America from Ireland.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的祖先从爱尔兰来到美国。

sentence.Network_cn: 崇拜祖先的风俗在这些人中是普遍的.

entry.def: Your ancestors are the people from whom you are descended.

example.ex: ...our daily lives, so different from those of our ancestors...
example.tran: 与我们祖先的生活有着天壤之别的我们的日常生活

example.ex: He could trace his ancestors back seven hundred years.
example.tran: 他的先祖可以上溯到700年前。

entry.def: An ancestor of something modern is an earlier thing from which it developed.

example.ex: The direct ancestor of the modern cat was the Kaffir cat of ancient Egypt...
example.tran: 现代猫的直系原种是古埃及的卡菲尔猫。

example.ex: The immediate ancestor of rock 'n' roll is rhythm-and-blues.
example.tran: 摇滚乐直接源自节奏布鲁斯。
